projects.title: Klimakarten
projects.description: In collaboration with the newspaper taz, we designed and produced both physical and digital postcards containing visualizations covering various aspects of climate protection and mitigation in Germany.

projects.title: Instavis
projects.description: How can we bring data visualization to Instagram? What are successful aesthetic choices and tools to stop our social media readers from scrolling further? “Instavis” is a laboratory for data journalism done on Instagram.

projects.title: Temporal Topologies
projects.description: With the Temporal Topologies project we are attempting to support humanistic and hermeneutic approaches to temporality and chronology by creating graphical tools in which to create, display, analyze, and interpret temporal models.

projects.title: Wohin das Geld fließt
projects.description: Germany is one of the largest donors to water projects worldwide. For this project, we supported journalists at taz in creating micro-narratives driven by data visualization within the wider frame of articles.

projects.title: Inter...what? Intersectionality!
projects.description: Same qualification. Same resume. Same application. Why is Sandra invited for the job interview but Meryem is not? A visual introduction into the topics of intersectionality, discrimination and privilege.

projects.title: Touch Touch Swipe
projects.description: How are our personal relationships mirrored in our Instagram feed? What makes us invest our valuable time into using the app each and every day? With the project ‘touch, touch, swipe’, we aimed to investigate these questions.

projects.title: Data Talks / Data Walks
projects.description: Sensors are more and more pervasive in our everyday life. What happens if we use them to monitor subjective experiences? “Data Talks / Data Walks” is a hybrid exercise combining journalism, data visualization and coding.

projects.title: Commuting Stories
projects.description: Commuting is a common, daily experience. Often labeled as an annoying and demanding practice, it is becoming a more and more present aspect in our lives. What can we learn from who is commuting everyday?

projects.title: Times of a Square
projects.description: Berlin is a heterogeneous, multifaceted, and busy city, in which everything seems to happen at the same time. Time, indeed, plays a fundamental role in shaping the city and the way citizens live it. What if we could read the city's time like we read a book?

projects.title: The Anti-Wishcycling Guide
projects.description: Same qualification. Same resume. Same application. Why is Sandra invited for the job interview but Meryem is not? A visual introduction into the topics of intersectionality, discrimination and privilege.
